Replies.Reply: Your Majesty would wish to know the true facts concerning the island of Hispanola, our first settlement in the New World, and the activities there of your servant, Christopher Columbus, Admiral of the Ocean Sea, Governor of that Island.  You will remember with what hopes and promises he beguiled us -- the truth is that he now presides over a state of chaos, degradation and madness beyond imagining.

From the beginning, Columbus proved himself incapable of managing the affairs of the island.  He appointed his brothers to important positions, at once injuring the pride and dignity of the nobles who had gone with him.  He promised to build a city, the City of Isabel, named after Your Majesty.  What he actually built was nothing but a collection of huts, and that in the wrong place, for all of it was easily swept away by rain and mud.
Since provocation and injustice never ceases, many of the Indians have fled to the forests, or have begun to slay the Christians.
Is that not true also, Brother Buyl?
He has lost control.  His great arrogance has led him into depravity.  He encourages our soldiers to marry the native women.
Yes, Your Majesty.
Suppose you cross this ocean.
Indeed.  The world is full of mercenaries -- and states often make use of them, when it benefits them.
My only concern is the welfare and prosperity of Spain.
Go on!
It's very underdone.
No, the pheasant.  It's almost raw.
No?
I remind you, Senor Colon, that you are in no position to bargain with me.
Then you are too ambitious.
If you won't accept our proposal, we'll simply find someone who will.
On the contrary, Your Eminence.  It seems to me the man is preparing his own cross.
Forgive me, Don Colon.  But what about gold?
To your second expedition.
Don Colon -- Don Alonso de Bobadilla.  A man who knows our laws.
Don Bobadilla is already a judge, my Dear Don Cristobal.
You seem to have a special talent for making friends.
To rise so high, in so short a time, is a dangerous occupation.
A little hypocrisy goes a long way.
Every ship returns with a cargo of sick and dying.  But with no gold!
He must be replaced.
It does not belong to him.
Then why?
All I have to do is call the guards.
I am not afraid of you.  You are nothing but a dreamer.
You can see for yourself.
Yes, Your Honor.
Yes, Your Majesty.
Yes, Your Honor.  It is all true.
What kind of disease is this?
God forgive us!
I wish to go back with them, Don Colon.  I have no desire to remain in this godless place.
You treat Christians equally with heathen savages.  You execute members of the nobility.  And what do you offer in return?
Yes, Your Majesty.  It is all true.
Could it be so?
Is that the man I knew, Treasurer Sanchez?
The ocean is uncrossable?
That she was impregnable.
I cannot ignore the verdict of my council.
How little you know.
You show no inclination to speak otherwise!
A woman?
How old are you, Senor Colon?
You will be informed of our decision.
Yes.  It would be a pity, wouldn't it?
Call him back!
Do they have such thoughts?
We are more than gratified.
Will he survive?
We weren't expecting immediate profits, were we?  We must have faith.  We must give time for time.
Is this true, Brother Buyl?
Then, what do you suggest, Don Sanchez?
And who would you think of, for such a task?
Is he?
Really?
But without your brothers.  Nor are you to return to Santo Domingo or any of the other colonies.  You may explore the continent.
I know, I should not tolerate his impertinence.
Because he is not afraid of me.
Diego!
Look, Father!
Father?
What can you do?
You can't go there!
I want to go with you!
You promise?
Do you swear on all the Holy Saints in heaven?
Father?
This time with me!
Nobody is forcing you to come with us.
She's very beautiful!  The Queen has very good taste.  Diego is getting married.
Not bad.
I don't understand.
I am not listening, Father.  But I can't help hearing.
This one is from Mendez!
He asks when he can come to visit you.  He left his address.
I want you to tell me everything you remember, Father.  From the beginning.  Everything.
Tell me the first thing that comes to your mind.
Fernando!
Diego!  Aren't you going to kiss your brother?
Father, I am doing what I think is the best for him.  And he has the teacher I would have chosen for myself.
How did you manage it?
By sailing West across the Ocean Sea.
Ignorance!  I believe the Indies are no more than 750 leagues west of the Canary Islands.
So was Christ!
Passion is something one cannot control!
Diego.
Would you like to come and stay with us?
I'll do whatever makes you happy.
Fernando!
Fernando!
Executions.  In the square.
They've agreed to see me in a week.
I could be gone for years.
I haven't given you much of a life.
Are we going to argue?
Fernando, don't you think we are lucky to live with such a beautiful woman?
Yes, your Eminence.  The voyage should not take more than six or seven weeks.
Your Excellencies are aware of the statements of Marin de Tyr?
The Florentine Toscanelli and the French Cardinal Pierre d'Ailly both think that Marin de Tyr is accurate in his calculations.  And therefore, that the ocean can be crossed.
Seven weeks.  Six, during the summer months.
We wouldn't have to turn back!  We would find land at this point!
Excellency, you are right.
Therefore, as a modest man, I wonder:  who is right?
Who is right?  This question remains unanswered.
Your Eminence, there is only one way to settle the matter.  And that is to make the journey.
If they agree to follow me, yes.
Trade, Your Excellency.  According to Marco Polo, the Kingdom of China is one of the richest of the world.
No.  The Portuguese have already discovered black-skinned people.  I, too, will find other populations --
Did He not choose a carpenter's son to reveal Himself to the world?
Blind faith is what I consider heresy!
Asia can be found to the west -- and I will prove it.
They didn't listen.  They didn't want to listen!
Wait!  I've waited seven years already!  How much longer do you want me to wait?
Damn God!
Damn all of you!  You all set up theories based on what?  You never leave the safety of your studies!
These don't mean anything!  They're full of assumptions!  Out of the heads of old men who've never been past the end of their gardens!
All of them!  Just lies!
Where can I meet this man?
Is this a good time to meet her?
No more than the woman who said she would take Granada from the Moors.
What did they say about Granada before today?
Surely you can do anything you want.
May I speak freely?
Actually, I thought you were younger than me!
I WON'T!
If I am right, my requests are fair!
I'm not bargaining!
And were you never ambitious, Excellency?  Or is ambition only a virtue among the nobles, a fault for the rest of us?
If you can do that, Excellency --
YEEEEEEES!
She said yes.
I don't want you to wait for me.
Why not?
There aren't any monsters, Fernando.
There'll be a time.
Forgive me, Father.  For I have sinned.
Father, I have betrayed my family.
I lied.  The journey will be longer than I said.
You are bound by an oath, Father.
Give me absolution.
Give me absolution, Father!
Be good to your mother, Fernando.
Diego!  Here!
I have to tell you Santangel.  I don't know where on earth I am going!
What is it Mendez?  Speak!
And what do you think Mendez?
Come over here.
Now, find the North Star.  Do you have it?
Don't move!  A mistake of one degree and we'll be off 6,000 leagues!
What do you read?
That's it.  The twenty eighth parallel.  And we'll follow it until we reach land.
Six hundred and twenty nine.
Granted.
Six days ago, yes.
We have to keep the hopes of these men alive!
You think I don't know that?
The land is there.  I know it!
And then what?  Half of the water has gone, the rest is nearly putrid!
You never did.  You did all the talking for both of us, remember?
You're right.  Let the men decide.
Who gave you the order to come on board?
Cursed?
This boy has the voice of an angel.
This jacket to the first man who sights land!  I want a man up that mast day and night.
You start first.
Pinzon, the more I sail, the luckier I get.
Mendez!  Mendez!
In the name of their Gracious Majesties of Castille and Aragon, and by all the powers vested in me, I claim this island and name it San Salvador.
We have come here in peace, and we will behave with honor.  They are not savages and neither will you be.
Give it to him!
What is it?  A tribe?  An island?
Help him!
Utapan!  Wait!
No.  It's enough.  What would you say to a drop of Jerez, Pinzon?
Tell the Chief we thank him.
Tell him his country is very beautiful.  Tell him we are leaving men here -- to build a fort.
Tell him we will return very soon.
Thousands.
To bring the word of God.
He has medicine.
Tell him we admire his people.
Get below!  All of you!  Go!
Stay with me!
We may have to cut it!
I'll stay here -- to decide if we cut it.  Help me!
Now go!
I said -- below deck, Mendez!
Damn you!
The Indians have no such word, Don Moxica.
They don't see sin in their nakedness.  They live according to nature, in a never ending summer.
These are gifts for Your Majesty.
Forgive me, Don Bobadilla -- those positions have already been taken.
Bartolome and Giacomo Colon.
But we do have a lack of notaries.
Good!  We are also in need of judges.  Except there are no thieves!
I need both of you.  What are you afraid of?  We are living what we always dreamt of.
Are you saying you refuse to help?
Let me show you something.
Now -- you tell me.  Who can I trust?
We're brothers!  We must be a House.
He is here!  What is it?
I know.  I saw them!  Who did we hire today?
The royal surgeon?  Then we can count on royal health!
He's growing up!
Beatrix, I want to ask you something.
I can arrange for the Queen to take Fernando and Diego into her service.
It is a great honor.  We could not hope for anything better.
No Guevara.  There will be no revenge.
If you want to keep your head on your shoulders, you'll do as I say.
You want a war?  Fine.  We are a thousand.  They outnumber us by ten!
We came here to stay!  To build!
Ask the Chief what happened to my men?
Tell the Chief we will not harm his people, even though we have the power to do it.
We will work with his people.  We want peace.  Ask the Chief if he understands?
Ask him if he will help.
Don Moxica -- we need your horse.
We can't raise the wheel without it.
Don Moxica -- we all have to work.
Forgive me, Don Moxica.  But it was your horse I was talking about.
Thank you, Don Moxica.
Eat!  I'll tell you later.
Iguana.
What wrong with it?  The Indians eat it!
We've got to learn to live like the Indians.
Eat your Iguana!
How much gold have we found?
Perhaps it doesn't exist anywhere but in my imagination.
Then I'm Governor of the Mosquitoes.
In one act of brutality, you have created chaos.  Tribes who were fighting each other are now joining forces against us!  All that because of your criminal savagery!
You'll be held in detention, deprived of your privileges and possessions.  Until you are returned to Spain where you will be judged.
You have to find them, Utapan.  Look what they did!
We have to stop this war.
Do you know them?
Stop!  Stop this!
You may do as you please, Brother Buyl -- though your departure will not help me to make it more Godly.
A new world, Brother Buyl.
This is not how I imagined it to be.
Utapan!
Utapan, won't you speak to me?  You used to know how to speak to me.
Let it go!  Let it go!
Appointment to what?
Congratulations.  Then I am free to search for the mainland.
How far from here?
How could I be?  The mainland has been found.  Exactly as I said it would.
A man!  Diego, how did this happen?
Good!  I have to go back!
I have to explore the mainland.
I am happy for you, Diego.
Now I do look older than you.
Thank you.
Your Majesty -- some men are content to read about things.  I must see them with my own eyes.  I cannot be other than I am.
Call them.
Look out of that window.
What do you see?
All of them created by people like me.
No matter how long you live, Sanchez, there's something that will never change between us.  I did it!
God, how much I've missed you!
But as least we haven't been bored, have we?
How are you feeling, Fernando?
You know what I always used to do?
Swallow a piece of pork fat on a string.  It always worked.
Tell me what he's saying.
Ask him if he means a lake.  A big lake.
There must be a passage to that other ocean.
Out!  Get out!
Take it.  Come on.  Drink.
Your brother was right.  I should have never taken you with me.  I'll never forgive myself.  Never!
Will you ever forgive me?
Captain Mendez!
You'll always be older than me, Father.
Have you ever forgiven me?
I have to disagree.
New worlds create new people.
Can't you stay with us a little?
I can't keep my eyes off you.  I would like to catch up with all the moments I didn't spend with you.
What are you listening to?
But how is he?  And Dona Maria?
What does he say?
Really?
Diego, take Fernando to the dining hall.  He must be hungry.
Just be careful you don't lose him.
I have something for you.
That's what it says.
With some difficulty.  I had to promise them you were not a total fool.
Why do you wish to sail west?
How can you be so certain?  The Ocean is said to be infinite.
How can you be so certain?
Esdras is a Jew.
Father Marchena!
You get so carried away when you are being contradicted!
Only God knows the meaning of such words, my son.
You mustn't give way to despair.
If God intends you to go, then you will go.
Colon!
Colon!  Don't!
In Nomine Patris et Filius, et Spiritus Sancti.
I am listening, my son.
What are you saying?
How long?
Christopher, you must speak to them.
Ispo Te Absoluto.  May God forgive you and have mercy on your soul, Christopher Columbus.  Go in peace.
I suppose we're both old men now.
Yes.  I forgave you a long time ago.
Do you remember when you said that people talk about the world, but never leave their gardens.
I knew you would.
Oh?  So you are a new man?
God bless you, and those like you!
Yes, Father.
I am happy, Father.
Nothing.  That's the point, Fernando.
Santangel is going to see the Queen.
Go back?
In your present state it is madness, Father!
I can't go anyway.
I know.
I'd love to argue with you sometimes.  But you're never here!
I find that hard to believe.
I'm not asking you to swear to anything.
That's something you can't decide.
Speak to Diego.
You don't usually ask.
For once I wish you weren't right.
I am busy inside.
Christopher Columbus?
And Colon -- the one who populates!
You say Asia can be found by sailing west?
Are you familiar with the work of Aristotle?  Erathostene?  Ptolemeus?
But you may have found new evidence proving that these men of knowledge are totally mistaken!
Marin de Tyr is wrong -- and has been corrected many times over the centuries by the finest geographers.
Senor Colon, an experienced captain such as yourself will understand our concern with the crew.  I am not willing to have on my conscience the loss of men who would have relied upon our judgment.
Your life, and that of others!
Is that all that interests you?
Christopher -- Christo Ferens -- the Bearer of the Cross!
If God intended our proximity to Asia, do you believe he would have waited for you to show it to the world?
So you consider yourself the chosen one?
Don't you realize your words could be considered heretical?
IF-GOD-WILLS-IT!
The Treasurer of Spain honors us with his presence.
The Judgment is ours!
He is a mercenary!  Did he not already try to convince the King of Portugal of his absurd notions?
It won't be easy to get rid of your prophet now, Don Sanchez.
Spain -- by Your Majesty's grace --
We are.
In your opinion, how long would the voyage be?
How would the crew survive without being able to land for fresh water?
Senor Colon?
Ah, thank God!  I've been looking all over Seville for you!  Never expected to find a sailor in a monastery, eh?
Is he a spy?
What is it?  Are you a Trappist?
Jesus!  Just my luck!
Listen.  I'll do the talking for both of us.  You just nod.  Agreed?
You wonder why I believe in you?
I don't look like it, but I have friends at the Court.  The Treasurer of Aragon, for example.  He finances me.  His name's Santangel.  Ever heard of him?
So.  What do you say?
Immediately.
I heard.
I think I do.
You lied!  You cheated!  We're way past 750 leagues!
We're on the verge of a mutiny, Colon!
We're lost!
You don't know anything!  Listen Colon, these are my ships, right?
Jesus Maria!  I should have never listened to you!
You tell that to them!
Colon!
By God!  That's the worst trade of my life!
And a nice slice of Santa Fe lamb!
It couldn't be better.  Victors can't say no.
Take care of my investment, wherever you're going!
Granted his faults.  Yes, a hundred times!  But the man is still remarkable.
In a way, it does, Don Sanchez.
I beg Your Majesty to receive him.
One chair.  One table.  What more can a man expect, when he tries to sue the Crown?
On the contrary.  It is I who owe you everything.  Through you, I have been an adventurer, an explorer!
I wish you could have compromised.
The highest titles of nobility, Your Excellency!  To an immigrant sheltered by monks!
Underdone!  It's monstrous, Excellency!
They wave back.
The water's going putrid in the barrels.
Ah, leave him alone.  He's doing no harm.
They all laugh.  The BOY, hearing this, climbs to the crow's-nest like a monkey.
We left three weeks ago, Alonso.
Do something!  Help him!
God be with us admiral.
Well, I surely know what a quadrant is!  But I've never seen it used at night before.
Twenty eight.
To your post!  At once!
Continue rowing!
Alonso!  Jaime!  Don't let this wind escape us.
Shall I take my turn?
Arquebuses!
What's he doing?
We can't be.
How do you know land is on the twenty eighth parallel?
Chicken-ass face!
Shit!
I never seen heat like this!  Not even in Las Minas!
What are you listening to, chicken ass?
With a face like that?
I don't want you looking at me.  You hear?
We should have seen land.
Can't be that far, I say.  Also, I don't like the smell of the sea around here.  Smells like a cunt.
To where?
We set sail for greed.  God has abandoned us.  The voyage is cursed.
Of course it smells like it!  That's why sailors take to the sea!
Six hundred and twenty nine, Sir!
Captain, I don't understand.
Captain Pinzon requests permission to board.
Cuba!  Cuba!
Say not here!  Cuba!
Island.  Far.
He dead.
He cures.
You come!  You speak first!
Chief knows.
Chief says -- how many?
Why?
Chief says -- he has a God.
They here.
He understands.
You did the same to your God!
You never learned how to speak my language.
And you say this is an Indian vice?
Is this your new world, Don Colon?
We lost cousins, friends.  We will wash this in blood.
We don't need to know.
The monkey is lying.
We should kill them, Don Colon.
My horse doesn't work.
You did not hear me, Don Colon.  Not my horse.
To the Governor of the Mosquitoes!
Do you want her?
He's lying!
Bring him here!
Tell him to put his hands on the table.  Like this!
Tell them I want them to watch this!
I can't?  I can't?
Savagery is what monkeys understand.
You will regret this.
You know what they will say in Spain about my death -- don't you?
You are nothing!  You bastards will never inherit your titles.  We are everything.  We are immortal!
Si!  Si!  Muy bien!  Excellente!
I understand that you will soon be appointing Governors for the islands?  Is it not so?
May I ask by whom?
I trust they are men of quality.
Don Alonso de Bobadilla.
My letters of appointment.
Viceroy of the West Indies.
Didn't you learn?  The mainland was discovered.  Weeks ago.  By another Italian.  I forgot his name.
I am not a seaman.  But I heard it is no more than a week at sea.  I hope you are not too disappointed.
I am afraid this is not the worst news.
You might have given us a choice!
She's more than that!
He wishes he were back in the seminary.  Priests always eat well.
Not enough to justify a single shipment.
What will happen if we can't find enough gold?
Moxica is right.  Our ways don't work!
Can you find them?
You know I never shared those dreams with you.
Nima's a good cook!
What is it?
I'd like to know what I'm eating.
I'm not an Indian.
Nothing grows here!  Everything rots in the ground.  The wheat and vines wither before we can harvest them.
Where is the Admiral?  Has anyone seen the Admiral?
You animals!  Can't you wait!
Admiral!  The horses have arrived.
These animals should be shown what savagery can be!
No mercy!  Let's find them.
To the new world, my friend!  To the new world!
Three heads for every life taken.
I don't know.  It seems almost as if we have exchanged diseases with the Indians.  They die of our most common cold, and we of their plague.
It seems to be caused by intimacy with the native women, Your Majesty.
No, Your Majesty.  They go mad --
He says he has not found any!
He says -- water on the other side.
No.  Says those are lakes.  Water on other side big -- as wide as here.
I help.
Don Giacomo, you'd better come at once!
Amerigo Vespucci, Excellency.
"I should be judged as a Seaman who by Divine Will discovered a New World, and thereby placed it under the sovereignty of Your Majesties.
